page.title: 19St Peter's Hospice
page.content: A hospice was originally a shelter where travellers could be cared for. Today{St.Peter's Hospice (Knowle)} provides a source of care and support for those people suffering from progressive and incurable diseases. When death is near patients are brought to St.Peter's Lodge to spend their last hours in a caring atmosphere. Nurses are specially qualified to support such people who, in pain, are frightened of death and powerful drugs are used to alleviate needless pain. Nurses also visit homes of the incurably ill at all hours of the day and night. This is a{Christian foundation which has evolved over the centuries and is supported by many voluntary contributions and a great deal of help from local benefactors. The nurses are the only salaried members of the St.Peters Hospice.
